creator: larry.kriv@eds.com
text:
I am trying to implement Ant 1.7.0, upgrading from 1.6.5.  In doing so, I have 
also updated jsch to jsch-0.1.31 from jsch-0.1.24.  I use the scp task to 
transfer files from a Windows 2000 server to a UNIX server.  The files are in 
a directory structure and they are transferred to an identical structure.

I believe what is happening is in this sequence:
1) files in directory "A" are transferred to UNIX directory "A".
2) files in directory "A\B" are transferred to UNIX directory "A/B".
3) files in directory "A\C" are suppose to be transferred to UNIX 
directory "A/C", but this never happens.  The transfer hangs.

I believe that the scp transfer is having a problem transferring to the next 
subdirectory.  It is irrelevant what subdirectory that is.

Also what I have found:
1) Ant 1.6.5 with jsch-0.1.24 works.
2) Ant 1.7.0 with jsch-0.1.24 works.
3) Ant 1.7.0 with jsch-0.1.31 does not work.
4) Ant 1.7.0 with jsch-0.1.31 with scp parameter sftp set to "yes" works.  

There is no reason for scenario #3 not to work in our environment.  This is 
whay I am submitting this as a bug.

Larry Kriv
larry.kriv@eds.com

creator: ymnk@jcraft.com
text:
Please refer to the following bug report,
  http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=41090

If you can not use the nightly build of ant,
try to add 'sftp="true"' to scp task.

sftp="true" is exactly what I am using now to get around this problem.  I take 
it that the bug is fixed in the nightly build, which I do not want to use, as 
it is not "released/versioned" software.  Do you know when a formal update to 
Ant is scheduled to be released?

Larry
creator: larry.kriv@eds.com

text:
No release date for 1.7.1 is planned yet, for the time being use the workaround
indicated or an older version of jsch.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 41090 ***
